trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Batch account | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Batch account | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create an Azure Batch account in the Azure portal to run large-scale parallel workloads in the cloud
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create an Azure Batch account in the Azure portal to run large-scale parallel workloads in the cloud

trans-unit.source: Create and manage an Azure Batch account in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Create and manage an Azure Batch account in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Batch Management .NET
trans-unit.target: Batch Management .NET

trans-unit.source: The [Azure portal][azure_portal] provides you with the tools you need to create and manage an Azure Batch account, which you can use for large-scale parallel workload processing.
trans-unit.target: The [Azure portal][azure_portal] provides you with the tools you need to create and manage an Azure Batch account, which you can use for large-scale parallel workload processing.

trans-unit.source: In this article, we'll walk though Batch account creation using the portal, as well as discuss several of the most important settings and properties of a Batch account.
trans-unit.target: In this article, we'll walk though Batch account creation using the portal, as well as discuss several of the most important settings and properties of a Batch account.

trans-unit.source: For example, the applications and services you develop with Batch need your account's URL and an access key to communicate with the Batch service APIs, both of which are found in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: For example, the applications and services you develop with Batch need your account's URL and an access key to communicate with the Batch service APIs, both of which are found in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Azure portal currently supports a subset of the features available in the Batch service, including account creation and the management of account settings and properties.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Azure portal currently supports a subset of the features available in the Batch service, including account creation and the management of account settings and properties.

trans-unit.source: The full feature set of Batch, including creating and running jobs and tasks, is available to developers through the Batch APIs.
trans-unit.target: The full feature set of Batch, including creating and running jobs and tasks, is available to developers through the Batch APIs.

trans-unit.source: Create a Batch account
trans-unit.target: Create a Batch account

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal][azure_portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal][azure_portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **New** > **Compute** > **Batch Service**.
trans-unit.target: Click **New** > **Compute** > **Batch Service**.

trans-unit.source: Batch in the Marketplace
trans-unit.target: Batch in the Marketplace

trans-unit.source: Review the information on the **Batch Service** blade, then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Review the information on the **Batch Service** blade, then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Note that deployment model selection is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Note that deployment model selection is disabled.

trans-unit.source: This is because Batch uses the resource group deployment model only.
trans-unit.target: This is because Batch uses the resource group deployment model only.

trans-unit.source: Batch Service create blade in Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Batch Service create blade in Azure portal

trans-unit.source: The **New Batch Account** blade is displayed.
trans-unit.target: The **New Batch Account** blade is displayed.

trans-unit.source: See items *a* through *e* below for descriptions of each blade element.
trans-unit.target: See items *a* through *e* below for descriptions of each blade element.

trans-unit.source: Create a Batch account
trans-unit.target: Create a Batch account

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: **Account Name** -- Specify a unique name for your Batch account.
trans-unit.target: **Account Name** -- Specify a unique name for your Batch account.

trans-unit.source: This name must be unique within the Azure region the account is created (see *Location* below).
trans-unit.target: This name must be unique within the Azure region the account is created (see *Location* below).

trans-unit.source: It may contain only lowercase characters, numbers, and must be 3-24 characters in length.
trans-unit.target: It may contain only lowercase characters, numbers, and must be 3-24 characters in length.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: **Subscription** -- Select a subscription in which to create the Batch account.
trans-unit.target: **Subscription** -- Select a subscription in which to create the Batch account.

trans-unit.source: If you have only one subscription, it is selected by default.
trans-unit.target: If you have only one subscription, it is selected by default.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: **Resource group** -- Select a resource group for your new Batch account, or create a new one if there are no resource groups in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: **Resource group** -- Select a resource group for your new Batch account, or create a new one if there are no resource groups in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: **Location** -- Select an Azure region in which to create the Batch account.
trans-unit.target: **Location** -- Select an Azure region in which to create the Batch account.

trans-unit.source: Only the regions supported by your subscription and resource group will be displayed as options.
trans-unit.target: Only the regions supported by your subscription and resource group will be displayed as options.

trans-unit.source: e.
trans-unit.target: e.

trans-unit.source: **Storage Account** (optional) -- You can associate (link) a storage account to your new Batch account.
trans-unit.target: **Storage Account** (optional) -- You can associate (link) a storage account to your new Batch account.

trans-unit.source: The [application packages](batch-application-packages.md) feature of Batch will use the linked storage account for the storage and retrieval of application packages.
trans-unit.target: The [application packages](batch-application-packages.md) feature of Batch will use the linked storage account for the storage and retrieval of application packages.

trans-unit.source: See [Application deployment with Azure Batch application packages](batch-application-packages.md) for more information on this feature.
trans-unit.target: See [Application deployment with Azure Batch application packages](batch-application-packages.md) for more information on this feature.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] Regenerating keys in a linked Storage account requires special considerations.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] Regenerating keys in a linked Storage account requires special considerations.

trans-unit.source: See [Considerations for Batch accounts](#considerations-for-batch-accounts) below for more details.
trans-unit.target: See [Considerations for Batch accounts](#considerations-for-batch-accounts) below for more details.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create** to create the account.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create** to create the account.

trans-unit.source: The portal will indicate that it is **Deploying** the account, and upon completion, the Batch Account blade will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: The portal will indicate that it is **Deploying** the account, and upon completion, the Batch Account blade will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: View Batch account properties
trans-unit.target: View Batch account properties

trans-unit.source: The Batch account blade displays several properties for the account, as well as provides access to additional settings such as access keys, quotas, users, and storage account association.
trans-unit.target: The Batch account blade displays several properties for the account, as well as provides access to additional settings such as access keys, quotas, users, and storage account association.

trans-unit.source: **Batch account URL** -- This URL provides access to your Batch account when using APIs such as the [Batch REST][api_rest] API or [Batch .NET][api_net] client library, and adheres to the following format:
trans-unit.target: **Batch account URL** -- This URL provides access to your Batch account when using APIs such as the [Batch REST][api_rest] API or [Batch .NET][api_net] client library, and adheres to the following format:

trans-unit.source: **Access keys** -- To view and manage your Batch account's access keys, click the key icon to open the **Manage keys** blade, or click **All settings** > **Keys**.
trans-unit.target: **Access keys** -- To view and manage your Batch account's access keys, click the key icon to open the **Manage keys** blade, or click **All settings** > **Keys**.

trans-unit.source: An access key is required when communicating with the Batch service APIs, such as with [Batch REST][api_rest] or the [Batch .NET][api_net] client library.
trans-unit.target: An access key is required when communicating with the Batch service APIs, such as with [Batch REST][api_rest] or the [Batch .NET][api_net] client library.

trans-unit.source: Batch account keys
trans-unit.target: Batch account keys

trans-unit.source: **All settings** -- To manage all settings for the Batch account or to view its properties, click **All settings** to open the **Settings** blade.
trans-unit.target: **All settings** -- To manage all settings for the Batch account or to view its properties, click **All settings** to open the **Settings** blade.

trans-unit.source: This blade provides access to all settings and properties for the account, including viewing the account quotas, selecting an Azure Storage account to link to the Batch account, and managing users.
trans-unit.target: This blade provides access to all settings and properties for the account, including viewing the account quotas, selecting an Azure Storage account to link to the Batch account, and managing users.

trans-unit.source: Batch account settings and properties blades
trans-unit.target: Batch account settings and properties blades

trans-unit.source: Considerations for Batch accounts
trans-unit.target: Considerations for Batch accounts

trans-unit.source: You can also create and manage Batch accounts with the [Batch PowerShell cmdlets](batch-powershell-cmdlets-get-started.md) and the [Batch Management .NET](batch-management-dotnet.md) library.
trans-unit.target: You can also create and manage Batch accounts with the [Batch PowerShell cmdlets](batch-powershell-cmdlets-get-started.md) and the [Batch Management .NET](batch-management-dotnet.md) library.

trans-unit.source: You are not charged for the Batch account itself.
trans-unit.target: You are not charged for the Batch account itself.

trans-unit.source: You are charged for any Azure compute resources that your Batch solutions consume, and for the resources consumed by other services when your workloads run.
trans-unit.target: You are charged for any Azure compute resources that your Batch solutions consume, and for the resources consumed by other services when your workloads run.

trans-unit.source: For example, you are charged for the compute nodes in your pools, and if you use the [application packages](batch-application-packages.md) feature, you are charged for the Azure Storage resources used for storing your application package versions.
trans-unit.target: For example, you are charged for the compute nodes in your pools, and if you use the [application packages](batch-application-packages.md) feature, you are charged for the Azure Storage resources used for storing your application package versions.

trans-unit.source: See [Batch pricing][batch_pricing] for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Batch pricing][batch_pricing] for more information.

trans-unit.source: You can run multiple Batch workloads in a single Batch account, or distribute your workloads among Batch accounts in different Azure regions.
trans-unit.target: You can run multiple Batch workloads in a single Batch account, or distribute your workloads among Batch accounts in different Azure regions.

trans-unit.source: If you're running several large-scale Batch workloads, be aware of certain [Batch service quotas and limits](batch-quota-limit.md) that apply to your Azure subscription and each Batch account.
trans-unit.target: If you're running several large-scale Batch workloads, be aware of certain [Batch service quotas and limits](batch-quota-limit.md) that apply to your Azure subscription and each Batch account.

trans-unit.source: Current quotas on a Batch account appear in the portal in the account properties.
trans-unit.target: Current quotas on a Batch account appear in the portal in the account properties.

trans-unit.source: If you associate a storage account with your Batch account, take care when regenerating the storage account access keys.
trans-unit.target: If you associate a storage account with your Batch account, take care when regenerating the storage account access keys.

trans-unit.source: You should regenerate only a single storage account key, click **Sync Keys** on the linked storage account blade, wait 5 minutes to allow the keys to propagate to the compute nodes in your pools, then regenerate and synchronize the other key if necessary.
trans-unit.target: You should regenerate only a single storage account key, click **Sync Keys** on the linked storage account blade, wait 5 minutes to allow the keys to propagate to the compute nodes in your pools, then regenerate and synchronize the other key if necessary.

trans-unit.source: If you regenerate both keys at the same time, your compute nodes will not be able to synchronize either key, and they will lose access to the storage account.
trans-unit.target: If you regenerate both keys at the same time, your compute nodes will not be able to synchronize either key, and they will lose access to the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Regenerating storage account keys
trans-unit.target: Regenerating storage account keys

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: See the [Azure Batch feature overview](batch-api-basics.md) to learn more about Batch service concepts and features.
trans-unit.target: See the [Azure Batch feature overview](batch-api-basics.md) to learn more about Batch service concepts and features.

trans-unit.source: The article discusses the primary Batch resources such as pools, compute nodes, jobs, and tasks, and provides an overview of the service's features that enable large-scale compute workload execution.
trans-unit.target: The article discusses the primary Batch resources such as pools, compute nodes, jobs, and tasks, and provides an overview of the service's features that enable large-scale compute workload execution.

trans-unit.source: Learn the basics of developing a Batch-enabled application using the [Batch .NET client library](batch-dotnet-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn the basics of developing a Batch-enabled application using the [Batch .NET client library](batch-dotnet-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: The [introductory article](batch-dotnet-get-started.md) guides you through a working application that uses the Batch service to execute a workload on multiple compute nodes, and includes using Azure Storage for workload file staging and retrieval.
trans-unit.target: The [introductory article](batch-dotnet-get-started.md) guides you through a working application that uses the Batch service to execute a workload on multiple compute nodes, and includes using Azure Storage for workload file staging and retrieval.
